definitions: dangerously low body temperature occurring when heat loss exceeds heat production
examples: The hikers developed hypothermia after falling through thin ice
Emergency treatment for hypothermia includes gradual warming and warm fluids

definitions: imagined or assumed situation used for reasoning or discussion purposes
examples: The professor presented a hypothetical scenario about economic collapse
Let me propose a hypothetical question about time travel

definitions: surgical operation to remove all or part of the uterus
examples: The surgeon performed a hysterectomy to treat her uterine cancer
Recovery from a hysterectomy typically takes six to eight weeks

definitions: uncontrollable emotional excess characterized by panic or laughter
historical medical diagnosis primarily applied to women showing emotional symptoms
examples: Mass hysteria spread through the crowd after the explosion
The announcement caused hysteria among the waiting fans
Victorian doctors often diagnosed women with hysteria for various complaints
Freud studied cases of hysteria in his early psychiatric work

definitions: touchscreen tablet computer designed and marketed by Apple Inc.
examples: She uses her iPad for reading digital books and magazines
The school provided iPads to all students for remote learning

definitions: touchscreen smartphone designed and marketed by Apple Inc.
examples: He upgraded his iPhone to the latest model last month
The iPhone revolutionized mobile communication when it launched

definitions: portable digital audio player designed and marketed by Apple Inc.
examples: His old iPod still contains thousands of songs from college
The iPod transformed how people listened to music on the go

definitions: wild goat with long curved horns living in mountainous regions
examples: The ibex climbed effortlessly up the steep mountain cliff
Alpine ibex were nearly extinct but have now recovered successfully

definitions: nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug used to reduce pain and fever
examples: The doctor recommended ibuprofen for her back pain relief
Take ibuprofen with food to avoid stomach irritation

definitions: water frozen into solid crystalline form at temperatures below zero degrees
street name for crystallized methamphetamine, a powerful stimulant drug
examples: The pond was covered with thick ice perfect for skating
Put some ice in your drink to keep it cold
Police seized large quantities of ice in the drug raid
Ice addiction has become a serious public health crisis

definitions: large floating mass of ice detached from a glacier
examples: The Titanic struck an iceberg on its maiden voyage
Only ten percent of an iceberg appears above water

definitions: ship designed to navigate through ice-covered waters by breaking ice
activity or game designed to help people become comfortable with each other
examples: The Russian icebreaker cleared a path through the Arctic ice
Nuclear-powered icebreakers can operate for months without refueling
We started the meeting with an icebreaker to help everyone relax
The facilitator used a fun icebreaker game at the workshop

definitions: person who delivered ice blocks before modern refrigeration
nickname for preserved prehistoric human found frozen in ice
examples: The iceman delivered blocks to homes every Tuesday morning
My grandfather remembered when the iceman came with his horse-drawn wagon
Scientists studied Ötzi the Iceman to learn about prehistoric life
The Iceman was discovered frozen in the Alps in 1991

definitions: tapering piece of ice formed by freezing dripping water
examples: Dangerous icicles hung from the roof after the storm
The children broke off icicles to use as pretend swords

definitions: sweet creamy coating spread on cakes and pastries
formation of ice on aircraft surfaces or other objects
hockey rule violation when puck is shot across multiple lines
examples: She decorated the birthday cake with pink buttercream icing
The baker piped decorative icing roses on the wedding cake
The pilot reported dangerous icing conditions at high altitude
Wing icing can cause aircraft to lose lift suddenly
The referee called icing when the defenseman cleared the puck
Icing results in a faceoff in the defending team's zone

definitions: religious painting or image used in devotional practice
small graphic symbol representing a program or function on screen
person regarded as representative symbol of something
examples: Orthodox churches display beautiful painted icons of saints
The icon showed miraculous healing powers according to believers
Click the folder icon to open your documents
The app icon disappeared after the software update
Madonna became a pop culture icon in the 1980s
Einstein remains an icon of scientific genius

definitions: deliberate destruction of religious images or attack on cherished beliefs and institutions
examples: Byzantine iconoclasm destroyed countless religious artworks in the eighth century
The reformers' iconoclasm extended to challenging traditional social structures

definitions: person who attacks or criticizes cherished beliefs or traditional institutions
examples: The artist was an iconoclast who challenged conventional aesthetic standards
Corporate iconoclasts often drive innovation by questioning established practices

definitions: visual images and symbols used in art or associated with particular subjects
examples: Christian iconography includes symbols like crosses and fish
The exhibit explored the iconography of ancient Egyptian tomb paintings

definitions: thought or suggestion about possible course of action
conception existing in the mind as result of mental understanding
examples: She had a brilliant idea for solving the problem
The idea came to him while showering
The committee rejected his idea for restructuring the department
I have no idea what you're talking about

definitions: conception of something in its absolute perfection
principle or value that one actively pursues as a goal
examples: The house was ideal for a growing family
She represents the ideal of professional excellence
Democratic ideals shaped the nation's founding documents
He never compromised his ideals despite political pressure

definitions: philosophical theory that reality is fundamentally mental or experiential
practice of forming or pursuing ideals especially unrealistically
examples: German idealism influenced nineteenth-century philosophical thought profoundly
His idealism contrasted sharply with her practical approach
Youthful idealism often gives way to pragmatism with experience
Their idealism about changing the world inspired many followers

definitions: person guided more by ideals than by practical considerations
examples: The young idealist believed she could eliminate world poverty
Idealists often struggle in corporate environments focused on profits

definitions: representation of something as perfect or better than reality
examples: His idealization of rural life ignored its many hardships
The portrait was an idealization rather than realistic depiction

definitions: formation of ideas or concepts especially in creative or clinical contexts
examples: The design team engaged in rapid ideation to generate solutions
Suicidal ideation requires immediate professional mental health intervention

definitions: action or process of identifying someone or something
official document or card proving a person's identity
psychological association with another person or group
examples: Fingerprint identification confirmed the suspect's presence at the scene
The witness made a positive identification of the attacker
Please show your identification at the security checkpoint
She lost her identification and couldn't board the plane
His strong identification with the team motivated exceptional performance
Children's identification with parents shapes personality development

definitions: code, number, or feature used to identify something uniquely
examples: Each product has a unique identifier in the database
The software uses identifiers to track user sessions

definitions: characteristics determining who or what a person or thing is
mathematical or logical property of being identical or same
examples: Cultural identity shapes how people view themselves and others
She struggled with questions of identity during adolescence
The identity property states that any number times one equals itself
The police confirmed the identity of the victim

definitions: person who zealously advocates and follows a particular ideology
examples: Political ideologues refused to compromise on the legislation
The ideologue dismissed any evidence contradicting his beliefs

definitions: system of ideas and ideals forming basis of political or economic theory
examples: Marxist ideology influenced revolutionary movements worldwide
The party's ideology shifted toward more moderate positions

definitions: group of words with meaning different from individual word meanings
examples: The idiom 'break a leg' means to wish someone good luck
Foreign language learners often struggle with idioms and colloquialisms

definitions: person who acts in extremely foolish or stupid way
obsolete medical term for person with profound intellectual disability
examples: Don't be an idiot - wear your seatbelt
The idiot forgot to save his work before the computer crashed
The term idiot was once used medically but is now considered offensive
Historical classifications included idiot, imbecile, and moron

definitions: state of not being active or in use
examples: The factory remained idle during the economic downturn
His idle chatter annoyed everyone trying to concentrate

definitions: person who avoids work or spends time doing nothing
wheel or pulley that guides or tensions a belt or chain
examples: The supervisor fired the idler who spent hours on social media
Don't be an idler - find something productive to do
The mechanic replaced the worn idler pulley in the engine
The conveyor belt runs over several idler wheels

definitions: state of engine running while vehicle is not moving
examples: Excessive idling wastes fuel and increases emissions
The taxi sat idling outside the hotel entrance

definitions: image or object representing a deity used in religious worship
person who is greatly admired, loved, or revered
examples: Ancient civilizations created golden idols for religious ceremonies
The missionaries condemned the worship of wooden idols
The teenager's bedroom walls were covered with pop idol posters
Sports idols influence young athletes' training and behavior

definitions: worship of idols or excessive admiration, love, or reverence for something
examples: The prophet condemned idolatry and urged monotheistic worship
His idolatry of wealth ultimately destroyed his family relationships

definitions: extremely happy, peaceful, or picturesque episode or scene
short romantic narrative poem describing pastoral or rural life
examples: Their summer vacation was an idyll of beach walks and sunsets
The poet wrote an idyll celebrating simple country pleasures
Their brief romantic idyll ended when summer vacation finished
The novel describes a rural idyll disrupted by modernization

definitions: dome-shaped dwelling made of blocks of solid snow
examples: The Inuit family built an igloo for winter hunting trips
Properly constructed igloos provide excellent insulation from arctic cold

definitions: mechanism for starting a vehicle's engine
action of setting something on fire or starting to burn
examples: Turn the key in the ignition to start the car
The ignition system needs repair - the car won't start
The ignition of the fuel occurs at precisely timed intervals
Spontaneous ignition of oily rags caused the garage fire

definitions: lack of knowledge, information, or awareness about something
examples: Ignorance of the law is not accepted as a legal defense
His ignorance about basic science was shocking for a college graduate

definitions: large tropical American lizard with a spiny crest along the back
examples: The green iguana basked on a rock in the sunshine
Pet iguanas require specialized care including UV lighting

definitions: type of person or thing similar to those already referred to
examples: Politicians of that ilk cannot be trusted with public funds
We don't want troublemakers of his ilk at our establishment

definitions: problem, trouble, or harm affecting a person or situation
examples: Social ills like poverty require comprehensive policy solutions
The medicine was supposed to cure all ills

definitions: state or quality of being contrary to or forbidden by law
examples: The court ruled on the illegality of the search warrant
Questions about the illegality of the contract delayed the merger

definitions: state of being contrary to law or not authorized
state of being born to parents not married to each other
examples: The opposition questioned the illegitimacy of the new government
Courts challenged the illegitimacy of the executive order
Historical stigma around illegitimacy has largely disappeared in modern society
The inheritance laws regarding illegitimacy have changed significantly

definitions: person or thing not authorized by law or accepted rules
examples: The court declared him an illegitimate heir to the estate
They considered the referendum results illegitimate due to voter suppression

definitions: inability to read or write, or lack of knowledge in a particular area
examples: Adult illiteracy remains a significant problem in developing nations
Financial illiteracy leads many people into unnecessary debt

definitions: person who cannot read or write
examples: The charity teaches illiterate adults basic reading skills
Many illiterate workers struggle to find better employment opportunities

definitions: lighting or light provided in a particular area or space
spiritual or intellectual enlightenment and understanding
decoration of manuscripts with gold, silver, and brilliant colors
examples: The stadium illumination allows for night games
Street illumination improves safety in urban areas
The monk sought illumination through years of meditation
Scientific discovery brought illumination to ancient mysteries
Medieval illumination of manuscripts created stunning artistic works
The book features beautiful illumination with gold leaf details
